bow: and what are you glad you did know before having kids am glad did know what did know might not have had child am thankful every day did though would be able to breastfeed she have going on teeth before she was 10 months old sure there more but right now she wants my phone glad do know much about breast engorgement and spontaneous letdown at embarrassing moments and how hard dried milk drops are to get off the floor who the hell has time to mop ca speak for others but never knew have this feeling of impending doom have random dark thoughts sometimes like if my toddler trips and falls wonder what life would be like without her if she had broken her neck or if she starts to choke the worst case scenarios automatically start playing in my head like how fast can the ambulance get here what is my first plan of action irrationally fearful of so many situations but not so much that it inhibits happy living never thought that way also never realized how much importance my own health holds have to be here for her she needs me can totally relate every time my son is sick have to stop my brain from spiraling off into some tragic scenario also have been much more interested in health for its own sake rather than just wishing did look so fat in pictures or whatever which has been pretty welcome surprise do this too once forgot to buckle my daughter in and cried for days over what could have happened glad did know that would get really angry at my kid also glad did fully know that even though can get mad that the second they come to you for hug it melts your anger like ice in flame how much they enjoy playing with their own poop *shudders* am dreading this phase please tell me it just phase some kids do even go through that phase so do fret too much yet how painful and difficult breastfeeding would be really all the pain the aching back and arms from lifting and carrying baby 158452 times day the scratches all over my chest and bruises on my arms from being pinched and clawed the breastfeeding pains of letdown poor latch biting plugged duct the red eyes and cloudy head from not sleeping well in over year and then all the emotional pain the guilt fear anger mostly at myself frustration loneliness sadness more guilt anxiety yet the love is so intense and it just takes one baby smile or laugh to make it all ok yep just phase really sucky phase and should have taken stock in 409 and febreeze exactly my two oldest never did and my youngest is just shy of so there still time but the toddler did just ask her father if he wanted to go see the poo she just did lol what spinal headache *really* feels like thankful for my dog for this reason also handy now that he eating table food removed all of the poop why did anyone tell me how much poop there would be mean they are so little how does so much poop come out of something so small especially the first few weeks ugh and the stretch marks from gaining and losing at least cup sizes multiple times day removed not all kids play with poop lucky in that way in other ways gt irrationally fearful of so many situations totally agree it has lessened over time or maybe just better at suppressing or ignoring those feelings used to constantly go over how unbuckle the kids from their seats amp get them out of the car in case ever ended up driving off bridge or something into water hardly ever go over bridges and there are many places near me with deep enough water to swallow car ^^^i ^^^unbuckle ^^^my ^^^son ^^^first ^^^and ^^^push ^^^him ^^^out ^^^of ^^^the ^^^car ^^^then ^^^unbuckle ^^^daughter ^^^and ^^^pull ^^^her ^^^out ^^^she ^^^can ^^^hold ^^^her ^^^breath ^^^longer ^^^and ^^^is ^^^a ^^^stronger ^^^swimmer my ex husband used to think in worst case scenarios much of the time and we never had kids he mentioned how he would imagine in the middle of an argument that because of this argument would leave him for someone else and then he see me with him someday and he get angry and punch him and the other guy would fall back and hit his head and die and he end up in jail forever it was so unimaginable to me but have had child die and can easily picture what can happen try to not let my mind spiral off because know it can and know the darkness that accompanies it stop it and try to think about other things gon na go in different direction glad did know what adult life without child was like was pregnant with my oldest before turned 21 so did really get to experience the bar scene or parties or anything like that wonder sometimes if had waited if would ve even had children glad did know that kind of freedom do think would ve had children now ll just be the almost 40 at concerts and the fact that years later hate my boobs they do feel like part of my boddy hate anything touching them and my toddlers use them as handles when carrying them probably the most anger inducing thing ve dealt with in life it terrible ve contemplated if be happier without them altogether how much work it is mean knew some of it would be hard but may have had harder time taking the plunge if had known just how much it demands and how much things would change things like we ca easily go out to bars with friends anymore movies become an event to be arranged for instead of light fun thing in like years or so it will probably become easier to do these things again though removed deleted deleted amen sister this million times this always run horrible car accidents through my head for some reason also work in pediatric icu so see all kinds of worst case scenarios it so hard to distance myself from the ones that are the same age as my daughter still terrified of my kid getting cold virus because ve seen babies under the age of die from it have to keep reminding myself that see the sickest kids in the metropolitan area and for every one child we are treating there are thousands who are just fine or did require medical intervention for the same ailments was never worry wart before had her and just think in 20 or 30 years when our little ones start having their own little ones we ll have forgotten all the tough stuff all the worst parts all the daily grind and exhaustion we ll tell them things like oh you were pretty good sleeper or half truths like do ever remember you crying that much because thanks to the blissful forgetfulness that comes to every generation we wo remember how hard it really was wow reading all these responses so glad not the only one removed do hate me but how easy the infant stage would be we absolutely lucked out with baby who slept three hours at stretch from the get go is fussy nursed like pro did not reach that level of sleep deprivation everyone talks about though now that back at work it certainly impacts me more plus he in regression so it been double whammy but still not that bad glad thought it would be harder because my easy baby seems that much easier am sure number two will be hell on wheels devil child who makes me question the meaning of life also am glad did know how much would hate pumping or might have weaned before going back to work which really do want to do not ready to stop nursing but lawd hate pumping this is why have neurotic tendencies now constantly imagine unexpected car accidents like when backing out of driveway or pulling out into an intersection or crossing train tracks get thoughts of an unseen car or truck or train coming out of nowhere at high speed and crashing into us am so so so cautious because of this sort of to your point as well am super effected by tragic stories involving kids now because just imagine that could be my kid that alligator attack in florida effected me more than the orlando shooting breastfed my son til 19 months he had many teeth by then but he never bit me always amazed when see families who seem to be having an easy go of it feel like missing out on some secret think it just perception though we probably look the same from the outside too it is non stop work and by the time he goes to sleep and it finally me time all want to do is sleep yep knew all that people tell you over and over but you just do realize until it happens to you keep daily one line journal and try to write down the minutia the little details know we otherwise forget think and hope they will be wonderful keepsakes pretty sure it perception do have my doubts occasionally though it like when you look at someone facebook you only see the good parts they want to show everyone think some people are more suited to having children than others but do think it easy for anyone how tough having child would be on my marriage if had known might have opted out despite the uncertainty in my marriage my son is the greatest blessing in my life also what unconditional love really is do think this was correlation response just two individual thoughts bf my first til 31 months and at 17 with my second how uninterested my friends would be in knowing my kid we ve made new friends and put lot more effort into cultivating friendships with other parents because our old friends just do want to put in the energy to do something other than party with us removed ugh for reals my poor boobies look like purple zebras how it feels to not have slept through the night for years straight and that people will judge you for having kids who are bad sleepers because obviously it must be something failing at as mother how stressful colic can really be first baby charm second baby cried forever every day for months but then one day it just stopped it so difficult but then it just gone it was like whole new baby hey cheer up it could be worse you could be stranded on an island with only crudely painted volleyball for company do this as well although oddly most of my thoughts revolve around something happening to my husband he works away in remote location it called catastrophic thinking did lot of work on overcoming it when was getting treatment for an anxiety disorder have really done anything to deal with it since had my baby since it has gotten bad enough to disrupt my life but probably should do this about my husband too sometimes when would hear sirens and knew he was on his way home my stomach would feel queasy and get scared that something happened to him this makes me think of my mil who panics when my baby cries it been 24 years since she had her youngest but the woman had kids surprised at how anxious she gets baby crying something must be wrong nailed it yep exactly every fever every cough every bump and every bruise makes me panic what if lost him never recover have this as fear for second baby my lo is almost four months and only cries for good reason hungry tired needs to be burped or on occasion just needs to cuddle and doze on me hoping that since ll have experience by then might cope better thank you for the work you do ve never been so vulnerable omg every single time was driving across the bay bridge with my son on our way to visit family would be practicing that in my head open moonroof as were careening off of the bridge unbuckle myself jump into the back and unbuckle him swim out the moonroof so relieved there someone else like me that awful fantasized about double mastectomy few times during the first months of struggle to breastfeed hope it gets better removed ugh this is soooo true they re so infuriating and then you re giving them kisses my daughter is it is true that we might not remember but it possible social media will remind us ca speak for everyone but many of our challenging days are recorded on facebook or twitter late to this but glad did know that staying at home is actually very complex issue with un foreseen challenges it certainly can be really fun and love how well ve gotten to know my son and how connected we are however had no idea how much also pinball between mind numbing boredom fear that my career is permanently derailed exhaustion with trying to come up with things to do all day loneliness and social anxiety about cultivating mom friendships sometimes all in one day now work part time and my son is at nursery three days week which is the perfect balance but if had better idea of what staying home would really be like that first year pretty sure would have put off having kids and would have my son think he was probably at the same level of crazy as was that first year with my son removed this drive my husband nuts with it husband did you leave this fan plugged in yeah what if toddler tries to unplug it and touches the prongs and electrocutes himself ad nauseum for every detail around the house im not the only one was wreck the few people trusted not to report my to child services not really but thats how guilty felt were like but nothing happened just could stop thinking what if glad never knew there were no days off with parenting being sahm no weekends no sick days no vacations miss that happy feeling of weekend free from responsibility and worry get breaks more than probably deserve thanks to an incredible support system of grandparents but those often leave me feeling bitter and resentful it was just taste of the old carefree easy life before being slammed back into reality with tired kiddo also remember thinking would be able to get so much done being sahm especially with newborn mean they just lay there right and as they get older gosh ll be so caught up will be super bored in our immaculately clean house and we will have loads of time to go to the farmers market or do amazing sensory activities outside by our big garden yeah what cesarean dehiscence looks feels smells like glad did know was going to end up having section would have been so scared before labor if had known in advance as it actually went down was at cm when things turned and we needed to do section immediately the eerie calm that took over was incredible and ensured still have positive memories of labor and birth was able to agree to the surgery right away and 10 minutes later had baby yes hear so often from mil oh my boys did eat that much my boys were good sleepers my boys did fuss okay lady keep telling yourself that ll add one glad did know how much my priorities would shift we pretty much reshuffled the deck when my son was born we moved to new city changed jobs so that neither of us has to go to an office or at all in my case re evaluated major goals had some difficult conversations about the state of our marriage happier now but also feel tad lost without the time pressure and structure of full time job and think would have been scared off of kids if had known how much would change in addition to just having him how much my child would be like me and how frustrating my personality can be sometimes she been typical three year old lately real sass hole and any time try to complain to anyone they just chuckle and say she is obviously my daughter going to be in real trouble in 10 years when those teenage years hit could agree more could believe how night and day they were first baby slept overnight by weeks baby nine months in now still waiting on it but you never know until it happening in real time number two could be even more laid back colic is tough but with the right support there is light at the end of that tunnel can only hope ugh yes this is so true bought car window breaker seat belt cutter for myself mom and sister they acted like had grown second head same all my friends had bad babies and prepped me for the absolute worst my beeb is like some magical unicorn but sometimes wonder if it partly because when things go awry think at least we do have to take turns rocking her in the bathroom with the shower going for white noise to get her to sleep day after day for hours seriously perspective has been so helpful in adjusting my expectations but also pretty sure my babe is sort of awesome that funny because we totally have to run the bathtub for white noise but usually only for five minutes haha always play that scenario in my head but driving alone with babies pretty much have accepted that we will die trying to escape because there no way leaving without both of them well it been way longer than that so glad did know how painful my recovery would be sass hole love it using this example my coworker wife had baby less than weeks ago he was back at work after week today she was posting pictures on facebook of herself in regular people clothes with the baby in carrier their dog on leash in one hand and her horse bridle leash thing in the other at the horse stables with her horses looking casual and happy and natural as can be feel like at weeks pp was still just barely keeping it together physically and emotionally starting to think maybe did handle the first few weeks home very well at all all can remember is mostly panic self doubt and not sleeping was depressed just very overwhelmed had sort of traumatic amp with nicu baby so felt real shitty with fractured tail bone episiotomy hemmheroids and pp anemia just remember not wearing anything but sweatpants for loong time anyway just had to get that out think you re right my bad was confused because many moms breastfeed through teething but those were definitely two separate thoughts oops yeah call shenanigans there is no way would leave the house probably for at least weeks think there is lot of pressure to have super fast recovery and be able to do it all its possible she was feeling ok but very much doubt she did very much out there or enjoyed it very much was probably exhausted after that where at with my mom sadly it made worse by the fact that she was sahm and work in an office 10 hours day plus traffic each way there is no possible way can keep my house as clean as the one grew up in but still hear about it every time she comes over at weeks could even stand up without cupping my pelvic floor with at least one hand haha love you really though remember that sensation it was difficult to stand or walk for any extended amount of time because of the pressure on my stitches this was why was apprehensive about having child my husband who has older kids with his ex warned me it could ruin marriage and sure enough it has certainly changed ours in way that we might not overcome but feel the same that love my daughter so much kind of less concerned about the marriage the volleyball sleeps through the night though postpartum ocd
